definitions.definition: The act of cramming (forcing or stuffing something).
A warp having more than two threads passing through each dent or split of the reed.
A mathematical board game in which players take turns placing dominoes horizontally or vertically until no more can be placed, the loser being the player who cannot continue.
A small friendship book with limited space for people to enter their information.
To press, force, or drive, particularly in filling, or in thrusting one thing into another; to stuff; to fill to superfluity.
definitions.example: to cram fruit into a basket; to cram a room with people

definitions.definition: To fill with food to satiety; to stuff.
definitions.example: The boy crammed himself with cake

definitions.definition: To put hastily through an extensive course of memorizing or study, as in preparation for an examination.
definitions.example: A pupil is crammed by his tutor.

definitions.definition: To eat greedily, and to satiety; to stuff oneself.
(British slang) To lie; to intentionally not tell the truth.
(British slang) To make (a person) believe false or exaggerated tales.
